title: The Coffee Machine Saboteur
setting: Pinnacle Financial, fifth-floor kitchen, Monday 7:30 AM
premise: Someone switched the premium coffee beans with decaf in the espresso machine over the weekend. Half the office is furious and nobody can focus.

suspects.name: Gina Torres
suspects.motive: Has been campaigning to reduce office caffeine consumption
suspects.alibi: I was at a wellness retreat in Vermont all weekend. I just got back Sunday night and came in Monday at my usual 8 AM.

suspects.name: Phil Morton
suspects.motive: Budget cuts mean he must reduce kitchen supply costs by 20%
suspects.alibi: I came in Saturday at noon to check the HVAC system. I was in the basement mechanical room the entire time and left by 2 PM.

suspects.name: Lucia Hernandez
suspects.motive: Lost a bet to a colleague that she could make the whole floor switch to decaf
suspects.alibi: I was home all weekend with my kids. We went to the zoo on Saturday and had a movie marathon on Sunday. I didn't come near the office.

suspects.name: Owen Pratt
suspects.motive: Complained that the espresso machine's smart features kept crashing his network
suspects.alibi: I was in the server room Saturday evening from 5 PM to 10 PM running updates. The server room is in the basement, nowhere near the kitchen.

clues.title: Weekend Receptionist Note
clues.content: The weekend receptionist only logged two people entering the building on Saturday: Phil at 12:03 PM and Owen at 4:55 PM. Nobody came in on Sunday.

clues.title: Elevator Camera
clues.content: The elevator security camera shows someone riding from the basement to the fifth floor at 6:12 PM Saturday and back down at 6:18 PM.

clues.title: Server Room Access Log
clues.content: The server room's electronic lock shows Owen's badge exiting at 6:08 PM and re-entering at 6:22 PM. Owen claims he never left the server room during his shift.

hints.text: Think about who was actually in the building on Saturday and whether they could have reached the fifth-floor kitchen.
If someone claims they never left a particular room, check whether the room's own access logs agree with that story.
